attributes.action: Smoking Should be Banned on Outside Station Platforms (Especially Merseyrail)
attributes.background:
"Smoking is permitted on our surface stations" - Merseyrail.org

Merseyrail allow smoking on their surface (i.e. outside) platforms. This is a disgrace! Platforms can become very congested with people and thus causing others to inhale second-hand smoke, including children and pregnant women.
attributes.additional_details:
One might argue that smoking is okay as it is still considered outside. However on the street people have the option to cross the road or move away whereas, at a station platform passengers do not have this option and instead must inhale second-hand smoke. 

London Overground stations prohibited smoking on surface platforms. Merseyrail is clearly behind modern times. If London has adopted this policy then why hasn't Merseyrail?

It is of this author's opinion that the Health Act 2006 should be amended so that smoking should be banned on any train platforms in England.

attributes.action: We want a government run school bus system similar to America's.
attributes.background: As a student I understand the ridiculous bus prices which we have to pay to even go to school. I believe that as we have a right to education it is wrong that parents have to pay up to £12 a day For us to go school. As well as this students who ride on private coaches have to pay up to £300 a year.
attributes.additional_details:
I know a student who has three siblings going to the same school. His mother has to pay £8.85 each day just for her children to go to school. 

I believe that the American system of having government run school buses is greatly superior to our system now.

I understand like most things in this world this will cost money, my suggestion is to raise council tax by £1-3 and use that money to set up a government run bus system. There are 27 million households in the UK, meaning £81 million a month.

attributes.action: UK government to  strongly criticise the human rights violations in Balochistan.
attributes.background: There has been persecution of religious minorities, targeted killings of civilians, ethnic cleansing of shia muslims, hindus, punjabis, zikris and other minorities by frontier corps and inter service intelligence agency.
attributes.additional_details: This has been brought up by the US government as well as by Declan Welsh in the Guardian. Also Marc Tarabella and Brad Adams (exec. Director of Asian arm of Human Rights Watch) have condemned pakistani government of human rights abuses in balochistan and Azad kashmir. These people deserve to live a free life in their own countries rather than flee seeking justice elsewhere. The UK government needs to show its support to humanitarian causes and rights in every corner of the world.

attributes.action: Introduce Entry Level Apprenticeships
attributes.background: We would like to initiate a scheme that allows access to entry level apprenticeships for those who may not achieve a level one qualification, Entry level apprenticeships would give these young people a future within well paid , skilled vocational jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
Many young people find school a difficult learning experience, some have the disadvantage of a learning disability, ASD, mental health issues  and or EHC plans which are not fit for purpose, as some young people's progression is slower and requires additional support. Some just have talents that are more vocational. Not everybody is naturally gifted at Maths, English and Sciences.
However, the system works to add to their disadvantages by favouring those who are more academic. It is very difficult for these young people to gain access to an apprenticeship because these require a level 1 grade,on completeion, in numeracy and literacy.

attributes.action: Decommission Sellafield safely and responsibly, it is too dangerous.
attributes.background:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iUE2846zgCA  
This link shows you a report about the dangers of the SELLAFIELD NUCLEAR INSTALLATION.
I call upon - all people in 200 miles of the SELLAFIELD NUCLEAR INSTALLATION, elected members of the government,  and anyone who loves our country, and its people.
attributes.additional_details:
It came to my attention recently that the Sellafield installation is actually in a state of overloading and dangerously falling into disrepair, due to lack of investment and reductions of staff. 
I ask you all to come together to force the authorities to make the necessary decisions to ensure the safety and security of this installation, which threatens the health and lives of many uk residents.

attributes.action: Stop development of new fossil fuel reserves to comply with the Paris agreement.
attributes.background: See for example : https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/sep/27/fracking-digging-drilling-paris-agreement-fossil-fuels

attributes.action: Make it possible  to  pay a modest amount as extra tax  to fund the NHS
attributes.background: So many of us deplore the state of the health service, and the conditions in which  committed professional staff are expected to fulfil the role. Allowing individuals to commit a dedicated amount each month specifically to be spent on the NHS  could correct this .

attributes.action:
Remove the UK from membership of the UN.
This organisation has become a pariah.
attributes.background: The UN has presided over countless deaths of civilians over the years and has lost its way in the new world of aggression where all countries seek are weapons and power. We need a court like system, signed up to by all with real penalties for transgressors.
attributes.additional_details:
I offer history as a witness and evidence. Name one conflict resolved by the UN?
It has become clear since the 1960's that the UN is an organisation mired in politics and self interest. The rules created for countries to debate are being abused in a wholesale and cynical fashion. Their must be a better way by way of a court which member states adhere to or else they are dismissed from the organisation. The bailiffs of the court will be member countries having no interest in the actions at hand and able to use full force to achieve the edicts of the  court. No more should soldiers stand by and witness rape, murder and torture. No more should cynical members be able to abuse the courts decisions with a veto.

attributes.action: Create a specialist police unit to deal with modern day slavery.
attributes.background: Modern day slavery is a big issue in the UK with the amount of people referred to the National Referral Mechanism up. I believe that the UK Government should create a national modern slavery unit to crack down on modern day slave owners and the human traffickers that get them into the country.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government's Modern Slavery Strategy:
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/383764/Modern_Slavery_Strategy_FINAL_DEC2015.pdf

The National Crime Agency's statistics on Slavery:
http://www.nationalcrimeagency.gov.uk/publications/national-referral-mechanism-statistics

attributes.action: Stop payroll co.'s charging admin fees to agency workers for processing earnings
attributes.background: Recruitment agencies use payroll companies to process agency worker earnings. The worker is commonly charged up to £20 per week simply to receive their pay! This equates to around £1,000 per year often taken from low paid workers.

attributes.action: Increase taxes and ring-fence the income for the NHS
attributes.background: Save our NHS and Keep it free.  Increase Personal Tax by a small amount  BUT make sure the tax raised is RING FENCED to be used ONLY for NHS and Healthcare purposes.
attributes.additional_details: Many people I have suggested this to seem to think it is a good idea.

attributes.action: Make teachers do inset day training in school holidays
attributes.background: School Inset days drastically effect working families and all training should be done during school holidays so as not to effect families daily routines as well as the pupils everyday learning
attributes.additional_details: Teachers set inset days usually just after school restarts from school holidays so why can they not do them during the free 13 weeks they have each year

attributes.action: Entirely ban the use of BPA for the packaging of any product sold in UK
attributes.background:
BPA stands for bisphenol A. It is found in plastics that are used in containers that store food and beverages like water bottles. 
Exposure to BPA is a concern because of health effects on the brain, behavior and prostate gland of fetuses, infants & children. Also links to infertility & cancer
attributes.additional_details:
Additional research suggests a possible link between BPA and increased blood pressure , cancer, infertility and birth defects.

http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/221205.php

The human experiment - documentary that can be found on Netflix / you tube

attributes.action: Completely change the old system of education we have today.
attributes.background: Uk needs a modern integral education based on the talents and abilities of students; so that when they finish secondary they know three languages and have a defined job. Children 0-6 years will learn playing, 7-11 years will learn practicing at school, 12-16 years will learn practicing in companies.
attributes.additional_details: The education be taught with computers and practices they will be guided by specialized teachers in each area; so that at years a child will be in the ability to program a computer and at 12 years he will have a profession. With the new system of education in the 21st century; let's educate for entrepreneurs to be those that produce jobs and not like the old traditional education, which teaches to create simple employees. We are going to take advantage of the new technologies and scientific advances to integrally educated and with high quality our children, who are the future of the Nation.

attributes.action: England, Wales and Northern Ireland to hold a referendum on Scotland leaving UK
attributes.background: For the past 300 years England has been held responsible for all the failures that has beset Scotland. A referendum was held and the people of Scotland decided to remain in the UK. I believe the concessions given to the people was unreasonable and very expensive for the rest of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe it has now become unfair that the rest of the UK is continually being asked to fit the bill in Scotland. 
It must be remembered that Scotland has free University education, free nursing home care for the elderly.
I do accept these are it would be good for all the UK to have these however, others accept these are affordable because of the subsidies Scotland receives. The latest request for half a billion pounds is the latest demand.

attributes.action: Amend The Equality Act 2010 to include lifestyle choices.
attributes.background:
Many companies in the UK are starting to use "anti-smoking policies" that they will not hire, and even terminate an employees contract for smoking, even if they smoke off the employers premises. 
I feel as if the government should update the equality act 2010 to include lifestyle choices.
attributes.additional_details:
Over in the USA, 30 States have made  similar legislations to protect workers personal life. 
If we amend the equality act 2010 to include lifestyle/personal life's of workers, this will include a lot of lifestyle choices, Anything from smoking to being vegan. It's ridiculous that some companies won't employ smokers. Why should a business go out of its way to not employ someone who smokes which is a personal choice, even if the employee agrees to smoke off premises?.

attributes.action: Scrap the 7 day week NHS proposals or fund them by the amount the BMA requires.
attributes.background: The "7 day week" proposals would stretch the already stretched resources and people of the NHS well past breaking point, and do Not provide the funding and staff required. The petition to have Mr Hunt removed was brushed aside, can we at least agree his policies need removing?
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence is in the proposals themselves and the medical practitioner's need to strike over such an unreasonable contract. No further evidence of inadequate provision is required, the burden of proof lies with those trying to push through the contract.
The BMA are the organisation representing the NHS and it's staff.

attributes.action: Make it law that all members of Parliament take regular drug and alcohol tests.
attributes.background: The government are accountable to the people and as most companies now test for drugs and alcohol so should Parliament as they shouldn't be running as ministers if under the influence

attributes.action: Instruct Southern Rail to reinvest all profits until they can run a full service
attributes.background: Southern Rail have been running a minimal and intermittant service while harvesting almost £100m in profit. Many of us will have had sympathy that they were dealing with a difficult situation with engineering work and civil action, however news that they are making such a profit shows otherwise.

attributes.action: Greater emphasis of nutrition & health education within the National Curriculum
attributes.background: Good nutrition is essential to optimise growth and development, and for the general well-being of all people. It should be a priority within the N.C in light of increasing rates of obesity, diabetes, cancer and other conditions. A large percentage of the population are uneducated on nutrition.
attributes.additional_details: Health education should be a core principle within the curriculum. Starting from KS1, children should learn the importance of food and how to cook simple receipes. Throughout the stages, students should learn how to cook a variety of healthy dishes, the importance of macro and micro nutrients, physiological and psychological impacts, body measurements, dietetics, metabolism etc. This should come within education. Many families/homes are now uneducated in this and heavily rely on processed foods.

attributes.action: Create an Autumn Bank Holiday in November
attributes.background: The gap between the Late Summer Bank Holiday and Christmas Day is almost four months. An Autumn Bank Holiday would provide a welcome break between the two. Perhaps it could be based around Armistice Day, November 11.

attributes.action: Make smoking any substance/cigarette illegal in the UK.
attributes.background: This is a very strong point I feel needs to be raised as the damage caused to bodies and minds from smoking is dangerous and worrying. It rips away at your organs and also influences children and young adults to smoke as they will begin to think it is an okay and unharmful thing to do.

attributes.action: Student Finance Company England should provide loans for obtaining second degree
attributes.background: Student Finance Company England should provide loans for obtaining a second degree. Wales and Scotland provide finance for students wanting to obtain a second degree, as England does not it deters individuals from furthering their education and pursuing their dreams.
attributes.additional_details: Funding should not be an issue and stand in the way of education as some households cannot support the financial implications of obtaining higher education.

attributes.action: Remove the charge for calling 101 non police emergency.
attributes.background: We shouldn't be charged 15 pence for calling 101, when calling 999 is free.

attributes.action: Introduction of Mental Health into National Curriculum and Hospitals
attributes.background:
We truly believe that more needs to be done in relation to suicide.

There should be no stigma attached to Mental Health and the only way to eradicate a stigma surrounding a 'taboo' subject is to educate by bringing it into National Curriculum and more information/care available in hospitals.
attributes.additional_details:
6581 committed suicide in 2014 alone, each and everyone of those people had a family, friends and countless people that would have been touched by their passing.
We passionately believe that the rates of suicide would decrease if Mental Health was part of the National Curriculum and the younger generation were aware of what symptoms to look out for in themselves and those around them
With that we also believe that there's room for improvement with information and Mental Health care in hospitals

attributes.action: Cut off all ties with Iran and cancel our part in the terrible deal immediately
attributes.background: The deal is a bad one, as everyone knows. It allows Iran to obtain nuclear weapons and missiles even quicker, thus endangering the security of Israel and the rest of the world. We want an end to this shameful and dangerous mistake at once.
attributes.additional_details: Obama lied about the deal as everyone knows.His clueless foreign policy is just to gain him anything of a legacy but he clearly understands nothing about the roots of terror and cares nothing about Israel's security. But our government should know better than to always bow to Obama. Phillip Hammond made a fool out of himself by trying to deny Iran wants to destroy Israel. Tony Blair and Gordon Brown would never have signed this deal and the Tories dare to claim they are more pro-Israel than them

attributes.action: "Parliamentary privilege" must not be used to keep members above the law
attributes.background: Despite having been jailed for fiddling expenses in 2011, a new CPS case of false accounting against sitting Tory peer Lord Hannigfield recently collapsed when Justice McCreath ruled he couldn’t be prosecuted for falsely claiming attendance allowance – on the grounds of “parliamentary privilege”!
attributes.additional_details:
This taints the reputation of both Houses, makes a mockery of reforms following the "expenses" scandal and sets the dangerous precedent of placing parliamentarians' expenses beyond public scrutiny or prosecution.

Therefore, we call on both Houses to debate and reform the practical application of "parliamentary privilege" in cases of prosecutable false accounting or fraud. Also, along with this, members subsequently convicted in the courts should automatically be deprived of their seats/titles.

attributes.action: Fit breathelisers on every car manufactured so the engine won't start if present
attributes.background: I am a coach driver for national express and every time I want the engine to start I have to do a breath test, should ANY amount of alcohol be found the engine won't start. This will reduce drink driving. We should have a zero tolerance against drink driving.

attributes.action: Stop BBC Threats to Spy on all WiFi Connections, make iplayer Password Protected
attributes.background:
On 01/09/16 paying TV licence free is required to watch iplayer.

To enforce this BBC claim they've developed new WiFi snooping detector vans, to packet sniff all WiFi connections to see if iplayer is being used.

This is a gross invasion of privacy.  Not wanting to watch the BBC is not a crime!
attributes.additional_details:
The BBC already have access to the information of who is watching iplayer.  When someone watches their IP address is logged on the BBC server, which uniquely identifies which internet connection has been using it. 

The BBC have the option to make the iplayer password protected, much like Netflix or Amazon Prime.  This password could be associated with a TV licence, so only licence payers can use the service.

Detection vans are an unnecessary invasion of privacy & waste of licence payers money.

attributes.action: Remove exemptions for child seats in coaches and large minibuses
attributes.background:
Children are protected (with few exceptions) from travelling unrestrained in vehicles such as cars, vans and small minibuses.

There is no such requirement for large minibuses or coaches. The law only applies to those over the age of 14.

Children under the age of 14 are being put at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
A baby on its carer's knee is legal. This child would be at serious risk of being killed in the event of a crash. Even a simple emergency stop risks crushing injuries between the adult and the seat in front.

Coaches and large minibuses must be held to the same legal standards as cars or taxis.

attributes.action: Ban, male only,  gender segregated, activities in all UK  sports facilities.
attributes.background: Women are BANNED from 'men-only' sessions at Luton's taxpayer-funded Olympic swimming pool 'for cultural reasons' and segregated in smaller community baths and segregated in smaller community baths.
attributes.additional_details: Women are BANNED from 'men-only' sessions at Luton's taxpayer-funded Olympic swimming pool 'for cultural reasons' and segregated in smaller community baths.

attributes.action: We the 17.5 million Brexit Supporters demand a general election immediately
attributes.background: Teresa May is stalling the process, meeting with Brussels, Angela Merkel and The First Minister of Scotland, and Is also allowing unelected peers to try and block Brexit, she is not honouring her pledge that Brexit means Brexit, she was not elected by the people of the UK

attributes.action: Cap private rents at Local Housing Allowance (LHA) levels in England
attributes.background: LHAs are not typical of private rents. Those claiming Housing Benefit still have to top up their total rent from other benefits - often an impossible task, leading to rent arrears and crippling poverty. LHAs must be brought into line with actual private rents, or rents capped at the level of LHA.

attributes.action: Reform of the UK's honours system, reflecting achievement, not money donated.
attributes.background:
The honours system has become discredited to the point that highest bidders win high honours, irrespective of their achievements and merit to the country.

Honours should only be given for real, tangible, honourable acts or achievements - not for political donations or doing a Whitehall job.
attributes.additional_details:
It seems incredulous that people are given knighthoods for doing Whitehall jobs they have been handsomely paid for anyway, yet doctors, nurses, consultants, teachers, firefighters, police etc all struggle to get recognition for saving lives and transforming society.

Handing honours to people who have helped individuals achieve office by money or political manoeuvring is sheer cronyism; the current system must now be overhauled to stop its dishonourable use and restore its proper status.

attributes.action: Investigate the fiscal soundness of every PFI contract current in the UK.
attributes.background: There is growing concern that the widespread use of PFI by successive Governments may have created a disproportionate financial stress on public services to the detriment of all.  A thorough investigation is therefore warranted.
attributes.additional_details: n/a

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for a company to keep quiet about a security breach.
attributes.background: If a company does not immediately inform customers of a data breach concerning their account details, that company is aiding and abetting criminal activity (the stealing of customers money and identities).
attributes.additional_details:
Individuals have a right to be told immediately if their details have been compromised, and where the company has been negligent customers have a right to be compensated. 

Introduce a law making it a criminal offence for a company to not immediately inform customers of any breach of security that may have compromised customers' personal information (identity) or payment card details.

attributes.action: Force bars, restaurants and nightclubs to sell more varieties of diet drinks
attributes.background: Despite an apparent obesity crisis in the UK and more people being diagnosed with diabetes, drinking establishments don't sell enough diet drinks. These venues should be forced to sell the diet variety of any soft drink they sell, to improve peoples health and wellbeing.

attributes.action: Stop doctors charging for signing cremation form
attributes.background: £168 for a dr to sign cremation form

attributes.action: Only allow supermarkets to have ONE isle for junk food (eg crisps and sweets)
attributes.background: Junk food is bad for us and causes many health problems so we need to cut down on the amount of junk foods avalible in shops. One way of doing this is instead of having one isle for chocolate and sweets in the supermarket and another for crisps only- we have one isle for them all.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.nhs.uk/livewell/goodfood/pages/sugars.aspx

attributes.action: Invest more in our National Security to avoid an attack in the UK
attributes.background: Europe is getting unsecured. There has been terror attacks in the most important countries like France, Belgium and Germany. The United Kingdom may be affected in the future as well. We more security, especially on train staions, crowded places, Tourist attractions and big cities.

attributes.action: Place an additional tax of 10p a packet on chewing gum to pay the clean up costs
attributes.background: According to the LGA it costs £1.50 to clean a piece of chewing gum from a pavement. Not all chewing gum users are irresponsible about its disposal but it is wrong for general taxation to pay the clean up costs. A levy of 10p a packet (plus an explanation on the packet) will offset part of the costs
attributes.additional_details: The LGA estimate that it costs £60M a year to clean up chewing gum. http://www.local.gov.uk/media-releases/-/journal_content/56/10180/6745145/NEWS

attributes.action: DVLA website services to be available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.
attributes.background: The DVLA website is only open Monday to Saturday 8am and 6pm to deal with certain issues (for example, telling them when you have bought or sold a vehicle). This is ridiculous. A website should be open 24 hours, seven days a week. There is no reason for it not to be.
attributes.additional_details: This affects us all by making it more difficult for us by forcing us to deal with matters during these specific times and not in evenings/outside office hours. The Government is here to serve us, the people, not the other way round. This is an example of self serving bureaucracy gone wrong. It's also wasteful, as it encourages people to deal with the matter by post instead of using the website. This wastes paper (and therefore kills trees) and creates unnecessary administration costs.

attributes.action: Change burden of proof of dangerous dog to be responsibility of the accuser.
attributes.background: Many innocent dogs have been seized from their owners and euthanised, and it is the responsibility of the respective owners to prove that their dog is not a banned type. This is a perversion of the burden of proof and needs to be changed so that the authorities must prove that the dog is banned.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, a dog is determined to be dangerous by the authorities based on the dog's appearance, rather than by hard evidence or by what the dog has done. It is currently the responsibility of the owner of the dog to prove the claim that the dog is dangerous to be false. If the owner cannot prove this negative, the dog is then euthanised. 

"Whether your dog is a banned type depends on what it looks like, rather than its breed or name." Source: https://www.gov.uk/control-dog-public/banned-dogs

attributes.action: Stop UK Airports and Private companies making money from Airport forecourts.
attributes.background:
Airports in the UK have gradually introduced charging for dropping off and in some cases are using private companies and the Police to enforce only picking people up from inside the terminals rather than on the forecourts.
I feel this is not a security issue but rather a money making exercise!
attributes.additional_details:
Heathrow - Dropoff only free and Police (HAL Bylaws) enforcement for pickup in terminal.
London City - Dropoff free and new enforcement of Pickup in Shortstay £5.50!
Stansted - Forecourt dropoff or pickup now £3.00 for 10 mins!
Luton Airport - Dropoff area £2.50 for 10 minutes and Expensive Shortstay for pickups.

People in the Hackney Carriage, Taxi & Private Hire industry especially are having a hard enough time making a living at present without these indiscriminate rules.

attributes.action: Release official files relating to past business dealings of Sir Mark Thatcher
attributes.background:
Downing Street files relating to past business dealings of Sir Mark Thatcher are being kept secret despite rules stating official documents should be published after 20 years. 
There is no legitimate reason to keep them out the public domain and they should be released immediately.

attributes.action: Ban people working when temperature goes over 30C or 27C in a physical job
attributes.background:
Bring in a law were employers have to send home employees when temperature goes over 30C or 27C when working in a physical job

There is no guideline on being sent home if the work place gets too hot, working in a too hot enviroment can cause dehydration and risk of fainting

attributes.action: Close schools when temperature reaches 30 Degrees Celsius.
attributes.background:
Should schools be closed in a heat wave?
Students are forced to remain at school in uncomfortable weather conditions, following their strict school uniform or business wear in sixth forms. These high, uncomfortable weather conditions enable individuals to feeling distracted and lose concentration.
attributes.additional_details:
Teachers also claim that  young individuals can become lethargic and less likely to concentrate. however, within hot weather conditions, students and teachers are also likely to faint.

Schools are due to break up for the summer holidays within the next week, but in the meantime many children are coping with “hot and stuffy” classrooms. And, should be shut within atrocious weather conditions. In addition, some schools do not have air conditioning systems or do not use them as they are costly.

attributes.action: Theresa May; Appoint a Minister of State for Climate Change
attributes.background: In Theresa May's first Cabinet appointments she abolished the Secretary of State for Energy and Climate Change moving the brief with Business. To ensure that Climate Change is at the heart of British politics we want a Climate Change Minister to work with all departments.
attributes.additional_details: Since the creation of the Energy and Climate Change department, climate change policy has largely been driven by using more sustainable energy sources. A new Climate Change Minister working in the Business department  could design new climate change policies that are not only just focused on sustainable energy sources. A new Climate Change Minister could be responsible for growing the green economy and encouraging corporate social responsibility.

attributes.action: Ban barbeque's within built up and residential areas in the UK
attributes.background: I find it extremely offensive to have to breath in smoke of any kind bellowing from a neighbors garden.The smell gets into my laundry that I hang outside and also my upholstery/bedding. It stinks my entire home out which also means theres no chance that I can enjoy an evening in my own garden.
attributes.additional_details: I haven't eaten meat for 27 years so I am fully evolved and for that reason barbeque's are extremely offensive to someone like myself and why should I have to put of with this smell in my home?Even if I wasn't a Vegan I would still find smoke bellowing through my home unacceptable.Please help me to ban barbecues within built up and residential areas in the UK

attributes.action: We demand Art. 50 of the Lisbon Treaty be invoked within three months hereof.
attributes.background: On 23rd June 2016, we, the people of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland delivered a mandate, pursuant to the EU Referendum Act 2015, that we exit the EU. We hereby demand that effect be given to said mandate by way of invoking Art. 50 of the Lisbon Treaty within 3 months.
attributes.additional_details:
"I do declare that no foreign prince, person, prelate, state or potentate hath or ought to have jurisdiction, power, superiority, pre-eminence or authority within this Realm." - Bill of Rights, 1689

These words serve to enshrine British sovereignty in its Constitution which remains violated for as long as the UK is a member of the EU. Notwithstanding a mandate to remedy the position by exiting the EU,  PM Ms. May suggests exit will be delayed or worse, not happen at all. This is unacceptable.
